intro: Ardisia aberrans, commonly known as the red-flowered ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. Ardisia aberrans typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in tropical and subtropical climates.
